title: Teaching Professor, Gies RC Evans Innovation Fellow, CITL Fellow
biography: Lawrence Angrave is a Teaching Professor, Gies RC Evans Innovation Fellow, and CITL Fellow at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. His research focuses on accessible education and effective computer science instruction at scale. He is involved in various projects, including the Universal Design for Learning (UDL) and Accessibility Research Group, ScribeAR, and ClassTranscribe. Angrave has received numerous teaching and research honors and is actively involved in university and departmental committees.

professionalHighlights.organization: Center for Innovation in Teaching & Learning

researchStatement: Lawrence Angrave's research focuses on accessible education and effective computer science instruction at scale. He is particularly interested in developing tools and methods to enhance the learning experience for all students, including those with disabilities. His projects include the Universal Design for Learning (UDL) and Accessibility Research Group, ScribeAR, and ClassTranscribe.
